Home → Recommendations & reviews → Reviews

Reviews

Read staff and customer reviews of books and reserve to collect from your library, or download to your device.

Less Than Angels by Barbara Pym

Written by The Borrowers Book Group · Published Jul 27, 2017

Less Than Angels is very well-written and features astute observations and laugh-out-loud humour

The Reader on the 6.27 by Jean-Paul Didierlaurent

Written by Chantry Journeys reading group · Published Jul 4, 2017

Chantry Journeys book group found The Reader on the 6.27 a larger-than-life, unique, original and absolutely delightful story.

Foxlowe by Eleanor Wasserberg

Written by Alice Violett · Published Jun 27, 2017

Foxlowe is an evocative, absorbing page-turner of a book.

A Discovery of Witches by Deborah Harkness

Written by Chantry Journeys reading group · Published Jun 20, 2017

A Discovery of Witches provoked lively discussion among members of the Chantry Journeys reading group

The Penguin Lessons by Tom Michell

Written by The Borrowers Book Group · Published Jun 15, 2017

The Borrowers book group found The Penguin Lessons charming, amusing and interesting.

The Stopped Heart by Julie Myerson

Written by Alice Violett · Published Jun 8, 2017

The Stopped Heart is an eerie and resonant novel with masterfully-created characters and skilful plotting.

Gone: a girl, a violin, a life unstrung by Min Kym

Written by Alice Violett · Published May 30, 2017

Gone: a girl, a violin, a life unstrung is a well-rounded autobiography of love and loss, endings and beginnings, sadness and hope.

I Let You Go by Clare Mackintosh

Written by Chantry Journeys reading group · Published May 18, 2017

Chantry Journeys book group found I Let You Go enjoyable and unputdownable.

The Bean Trees by Barbara Kingsolver

Written by The Borrowers Book Group · Published May 9, 2017

The Bean Trees is "a jolly good story" which gripped The Borrowers book group.

No Baggage: a minimalist tale of love and wandering by Clara Bensen

Written by Natasha Catchpole · Published May 4, 2017

Natasha found No Baggage a refreshing and lighthearted modern travelogue
